## NgxPrimerAccordionRootComponent.dataDisabledAttr property

Gets the value of the `data-disabled` attribute for the accordion element.

This property is bound to the result of the `disabled()` method, which determines whether the accordion is disabled or not. If the accordion is disabled, the `data-disabled` attribute will be added with an empty string value; otherwise, it will be removed (i.e., set to `null`<!-- -->).

This is useful for styling or DOM-related behaviors that depend on whether the accordion is disabled or not. It allows external tools or styles to target the accordion element based on its disabled state.

 

**Signature:**

```typescript
get dataDisabledAttr(): "" | null;
```
